newsitem.title: INDIA: Bombay shares end higher, Reliance rallies 3.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: Bombay shares end higher, Reliance rallies 3.6 pct.

text.p: A blistering rally by market favourite Reliance Industries on speculative bidding and buying support from foreign funds led Bombay's benchmark index to end in positive territory on Friday, traders said.
At the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the bell-wether Reliance stock closed 9.0 rupees higher, or 3.63 percent, at 256.75, in volumes of over 7.9 million shares. The share's high was 259.75 rupees.
"Reliance was the only major mover...some speculative buying coupled with institutional buying was seen..," said Ketan Jhaveri, chief dealer at institutional brokerage Kotak Securities.
The share jumped 12.50 rupees or over five percent to 259.0 at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) with more than 1.85 billion shares changing hands.
Traders said a few foreign funds have bought large quantities of Reliance stock in the last few sessions.
Trading activity in the broader market remained lacklustre with share prices moving in a narrow band, they said.
The top 30-share index BSE index hit an early high of 3,448.76 but ended 12.04 points, or 0.35 percent, higher, at a provisional close of 3,439.19.
Traders said investors were waiting for the government to followthrough on hints and promises by announcing measures to restore confidence in the capital markets before committing funds.
"People are adopting a wait-and-see policy. Buying interest is still there at lower levels," said Kotak's Jhaveri.
Among pivotal stocks, BHEL was up 8.75 to 230.0 rupees, Bajaj Auto 16.70 to 918.0, L&T 1.50 to 236.0 and Gujarat Ambuja Cement 7.75 to 237.50.
SBI however, lost 5.75 to 271.25, ITC 15.50 to 385.0, TISCO 1.0 to 189.25, ACC 15.20 to 1,332.50 and M&M 3.25 to 345.0.
The 50-stock NSE index ended with a marginal loss of 0.45 points to a provisional 985.80 in rangebound trade.
